DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Cistatina C, PCR, Log TG/HDLc e Sэndrome Metabѓlica estуo Relacionados a Microalbuminњria na Hipertensуo Cystatin C, CRP, Log TG/HDLc and Metabolic Syndrome are Associated with Microalbuminuria in Hypertension

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Cistatina C; Sэndrome X Metabѓlica; Hipertensуo;

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades de atenчуo р saњde humana

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo Fundamento: Em pacientes com hipertensуo arterial sistъmica, a microalbuminњria щ um marcador de lesуo endotelial e estс associada a um risco aumentado de doenчa cardiovascular. Objetivo: O objetivo do presente estudo foi determinar os fatores que influenciam a ocorrъncia de microalbumiњria em pacientes hipertensos com creatinina sщrica menor que 1,5 mg/dL. Mщtodos: Foram incluэdos no estudo 133 pacientes brasileiros atendidos em um ambulatѓrio multidisciplinar para hipertensos. Pacientes com creatinina sщrica maior do que 1,5 mg/dL e aqueles com diabete mellitus foram excluэdos do estudo. A pressуo arterial sistѓlica e diastѓlica foi aferida. O эndice de massa corporal (IMC) e a taxa de filtraчуo glomerular estimada pela fѓrmula CKD-EPI foram calculados. Em um estudo transversal, creatinina, cistatina C, colesterol total, HDL colesterol, LDL colesterol, triglicerэdeos, proteэna C-reativa (PCR) e glicose foram mensurados em amostra de sangue. A microalbuminњria foi determinada na urina colhida em 24 horas. Os hipertensos foram classificados pela presenчa de um ou mais critщrios para sэndrome metabѓlica. Resultados: Em anсlise de regressуo mњltipla, os nэveis sщricos de cistatina C, PCR, o эndice aterogъnico log TG/HDLc e a presenчa de trъs ou mais critщrios para sэndrome metabѓlica foram positivamente correlacionados com a microalbuminuria (r2 : 0,277; p < 0,05). Conclusуo: Cistatina C, PCR, log TG/HDLc e presenчa de trъs ou mais critщrios para sэndrome metabѓlica, independentemente da creatinina sщrica, foram associados com a microalbuminњria, um marcador precoce de lesуo renal e de risco cardiovascular em pacientes com hipertensуo arterial essencial. (Arq Bras Cardiol. 2014; 102(1):54-59)
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract Background: In patients with systemic hypertension, microalbuminuria is a marker of endothelial damage and is associated with an increased risk for cardiovascular disease. Objective: To determine the factors that may lead to the occurrence of microalbuminuria in hypertensive patients with serum creatinine lower than 1.5 mg/dL. Methods: This cross-sectional study included 133 Brazilians with essential hypertension followed up at a hypertension outpatient clinic. Those with serum creatinine higher than 1.5 mg/dL, as well as those with diabetes mellitus, were excluded. Systolic and diastolic blood pressures were measured, and body mass index (BMI) and GFR estimated by using the CKD-EPI formula were calculated. The serum levels of the following were assessed: CysC, creatinine, total cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, triglycerides, C-reactive protein (CRP) and fasting glucose. Microalbuminuria was determined in 24-hour urine. Hypertensive patients were classified according to the presence of one or more criteria for metabolic syndrome. Results: In a multiple regression analysis, the serum levels of CysC and CRP, the atherogenic index log TG/HDLc and the presence of three or more criteria for metabolic syndrome were positively correlated with microalbuminuria (r2 : 0.277, p < 0.05). Conclusion: CysC, CRP, log TG/HDLc, and the presence of three or more criteria for metabolic syndrome, regardless of serum creatinine, were associated with microalbuminuria, an early marker of kidney damage and cardiovascular risk in patients with essential hypertension. (Arq Bras Cardiol. 2014; 102(1):54-59) Keywords: Metabolic Syndrome X; Hypertension; Albuminuria; Kidney Diseases. Full texts in English - http://www.arquivosonline.com.br

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Cuidado Р Saњde das Populaчѕes Humanas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The human kidneys are located in the lumbar area, as a pair in the retroperitoneal space, and are composed of about a million nephrons, wich are the functionalunits. Each nephron contains a glomerulus wich carries out blood filtration and there is a tubular system, divided into 14 segments, wich are different morphologically and functionally. The combined action of these structure produces urine. This chapter discuss the correlations of renal structure and function and some disorders of them.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Fez-se uma revisуo de literatura, nos њltimos 15 anos, acerca do significado clэnico da microalbuminњria (MA), especialmente relacionando-a рs doenчas cardiovasculares (DCV) e seu uso como indicador diagnѓstico, prognѓstico e de eficсcia terapъutica, nessas patologias.Enfocaram-se situaчѕes de ausъncia de certas morbidades, como diabete medito e neuropatia, em qua a MA щ mais bem compreendida, para discutir melhor o significado clэnico deste sinal.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: There was a review of the literature in the last 15 years about the clinical significance of microalbuminuria (MA), especially relating to cardiovascular diseases (CVD) and its use as an indicator of the diagnosis, prognosis and therapeutic efficacy in these disease.
